intro: Pepinia juncoides, commonly known as the marsh hound, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its herbaceous, often semi-aquatic growth habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its root system is adapted to waterlogged soils, allowing it to thrive in marshy and boggy habitats. Pepinia juncoides plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
